description: Rishi Sunak and opposition Labour Party leader Keir Starmer clashed over taxes in the first TV debate of the UK election campaign, with the British premier under pressure and trailing far behind in the polls.
title: Sunak and Starmer Clash on Taxes in Feisty Election Debate

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, politics reporter Skylar Woodhouse looks at the impact of President Joe Biden’s executive order on asylum claims. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Biden Leaves Left and Right Fuming With New Border Restrictions

description: Jurors at the corruption trial of Senator Bob Menendez watched a secret FBI video recording of the New Jersey Democrat dining, laughing and pouring wine at a Washington steakhouse with his then-girlfriend and three Egyptian men.
title: FBI Taped Menendez Dining With Egyptians at Morton’s Steakhouse

description: Australian concerns about Donald Trump’s potential return to power are “baseless hyperventilation,” ex-Prime Minister Scott Morrison said, adding the former president is a major supporter of the US-Australia alliance.
title: Australia’s Fears Over Trump’s Return Are Baseless, Ex-Prime Minister Says

description: Undated file photos of Prime Minister Rishi Sunak (left) and Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer. Sunak and Starmer will go head to head in the first televised leaders' debate of the General Election campaign next week. ITV confirmed the Prime Minister and the Labour leader will take part in the show at 9pm on Tuesday June 4. Issue date: Wednesday May 29, 2024. 76361646 (Press Association via AP Images) Source: Press Association/AP
title: Rishi Sunak and Keir Starmer Kick Off UK Election Debate

description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz said Germany would only support European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen for a second term if her center-right European People’s Party can build a stable majority in the next European Parliament without support of the far right.
title: Scholz Warns EU’s Von der Leyen Against Coalition With Populists

description: Israel will start receiving a fresh batch of F-35 fighter jets from the US in 2028 after the two sides finalized a deal that affirmed their close alliance despite friction over the war in Gaza.
title: Israel Will Get New Fighter Jets From the US as War in Gaza Grinds On

description: US President Joe Biden may have just received a timely election boost from an unlikely source.
title: OPEC’s Surprise Output Boost Offers Biden a Break on Pump Prices

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was dealt a major setback in India’s general election, with his Bharatiya Janata Party set to lose its majority in the lower house of parliament. Modi has said he’ll remain in office for a third term, but the BJP will likely be forced into a coalition government for the first time since it came to power a decade ago. That leaves Modi and the BJP politically diminished after losing ground to a revived opposition bloc that successfully wrested territory with a campaign
title: India’s Election Surprise: What Went Wrong for Modi and What Comes Next

description: Hamas has followed Israel in balking at President Joe Biden’s efforts to end their war in Gaza, with both sides saying their conflicting conditions for a permanent cease-fire must be met before they’ll even agree to pause fighting.
title: Biden Bid to End Gaza War Founders as Israel and Hamas Push Back

description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s ambitious economic growth goals are at risk after his party failed to win majority support in the elections, making him more reliant on a coalition government to push through tough economic reforms.
title: Modi Coalition’s Narrow Win Puts 8% India Growth Plan at Risk

description: The Greek Navy resumed drills in an expanse of water just off the country’s coast, effectively blocking Russia’s ability to use the area for the transfer of petroleum between tankers.
title: Greece Deters Russian Oil Transfers With Longest Navy Drills Yet

description: Hunter Biden didn’t knowingly lie when he filled out a form to buy a gun in 2018 and checked a box contending that he wasn’t using drugs, his lawyer told a jury during opening statements Tuesday for his trial in Delaware federal court.
title: Hunter Biden Didn’t ‘Knowingly’ Lie to Buy Gun, His Lawyer Says

description: President Joe Biden is unveiling a series of measures to curb asylum claims and head off a surge of border crossings this summer in a politically contentious bid to address one of his biggest domestic vulnerabilities.
title: Biden Moves to Seal Border in Bid to Avoid Surge Before Election

description: Both major UK political parties are refusing to address chronic problems in public services and looming economic risks as the election descends into big rows over small pledges, two of the country’s top think tanks warned.
title: UK Parties Accused of ‘Avoiding Reality’ Over Big Economic Risks

description: President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador on Tuesday announced a plan to bolster Mexico’s health care, seeking to address a key voter complaint with his government following his party’s landslide election victory.
title: AMLO Rolls Out Health Clinic Funding After Mexico’s Election

description: The leader of South Africa’s main opposition Democratic Alliance said that investor optimism about it reaching a coalition deal with the ANC to form the next government isn’t misplaced and that it is open to talks that put the country’s interests first.
title: South Africa Main Opposition Sees Room for Optimism on Coalition

description: Brexit architect Nigel Farage launched his campaign to win the parliamentary seat of Clacton in a carnival-like atmosphere, drawing hundreds of people to the Essex seafront with his promise to upend the UK political order. But not everything went the newly-appointed Reform UK leader’s way.
title: Farage Hit by Milkshake as He Kicks Off UK Election Campaign

description: A German conservative lawmaker has filed a legal complaint against Sahra Wagenknecht of the far-left BSW party alleging comments she made about him at a campaign rally last month amount to incitement.
title: German Lawmaker Files Incitement Complaint Against Wagenknecht

description: After falling short of a majority in India’s election, Narendra Modi’s future is now in the hands of two notoriously unreliable allies.
title: Here Are the India Kingmakers Who Will Determine Modi’s Future

description: President Joe Biden said there was reason for people to conclude Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is prolonging the war in Gaza due to his own political considerations and would not rule out deploying US troops for the defense of Taiwan in an interview published Tuesday with Time Magazine.
title: Biden Says Reason to Question Netanyahu's Prolonging War in Gaza

description: Boeing Co.’s chief executive officer warned that a turn toward isolation in US politics could hamper free trade and damage the economy as the nation prepares for a pivotal presidential election.
title: Boeing CEO Warns Isolation Will Hurt Trade as US Election Looms

description: Italy is working with Group of Seven allies on proposals to support clean energy and food security in Africa that could be announced as soon as next week.
title: Italy Readies G-7 Plan for Food Security and Energy in Africa

description: Each day, Bloomberg journalists take you across a selection of towns and cities as they gear up for the big vote.
title: World’s Biggest Election Throws a Massive Surprise

description: Qatari mediators looking to secure a cease-fire in Gaza say Israel hasn’t yet put forward a position that’s supported by the full coalition government, complicating efforts to halt the near eight-month war.
title: Qatar Says Israel Struggling to Unite Over Gaza Peace Terms

description: Shipments are down by about 400,000 barrels a day over the past month
title: Russia Cuts Oil Exports After Pledging Redress for Excess Output

description: RTX Corp. is in the late stages of a deal to settle a criminal investigation by the US government into pricing for missile and defense services, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
title: RTX to Resolve US Probe Into Charges for Missile Contracts

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s ruling party is poised to lose its majority in parliament, forcing him to rely on allies to form a government. It’s a stunning blow to a leader who has dominated Indian politics since he first took power a decade ago.
title: Modi Poised to Lose India Majority, Need Allies to Keep Power

description: Egypt’s net foreign-exchange reserves climbed to an all-time high following a landmark deal with the United Arab Emirates that’s been dubbed the North African country’s biggest-ever inward investment.
title: Egypt’s UAE Megadeal Sends Foreign Reserves Soaring to Record

description: A Swiss-hosted summit on Ukraine will aim to carve a path to involving Russian officials in future talks after establishing agreement on nuclear safety, food security and returning abducted children, a draft document shows.
title: Ukraine Summit Opens Door to Limited Future Talks With Russia

description: China’s top diplomat said more than two dozen countries have expressed backing for Beijing’s vision to resolve the Russia-Ukraine conflict, days after China indicated it will skip an upcoming peace summit in Switzerland.
title: China Says Its Ukraine Plan Has Backing After Summit Snub

description: Thailand’s government plans to hand out 10,000 baht ($273) each to 15 million welfare cardholders under a cash stimulus program aimed at jumpstaring Southeast Asia’s second-largest economy.
title: Thailand Set to Prioritize Welfare Cardholders for Cash Handout

description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s Social Democrats overtook the Alternative for Germany in a new opinion poll, suggesting a string of controversies continues to erode support for the far-right party ahead of Sunday’s European Parliament elections.
title: Scholz’s Social Democrats Overtake Far-Right AfD in German Poll

description: The country’s fastest-growing religious group holds the keys to Brazil’s political future. Its president is fighting to regain their support.
title: How Brazil’s Lula Is Trying to Win Over Evangelicals Who Rejected Him

description: The German government wants to increase orders of crucial artillery ammunition that’s in dwindling supply and is taking steps to expand a framework contract with Rheinmetall AG, two people familiar with the situation said.
title: Germany Wants €880 Million More Howitzer Shells From Rheinmetall

description: A judge has summoned Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez’s wife, Begona Gomez, to testify as the target of a criminal investigation that has rocked the country for weeks.
title: Spanish Judge Calls Sanchez’s Wife to Testify in Blow for PM

description: Labour marginally widened its lead over the governing Conservatives as opposition leader Keir Starmer prepares to go head-to-head against Prime Minister Rishi Sunak in the first leadership debate of the UK general election campaign.
title: Labour Lead Widens to 22.3 Points, Bloomberg Poll Composite Finds

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Modi Is Suddenly on the Ropes in India Vote

description: Former Thai leader Thaksin Shinawatra will stay in the country to fight a royal defamation charge, Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin reassured on Tuesday, allaying any fears that he would flee as he did 16 years ago.
title: Thaksin Will Defend His Case, Won’t Flee This Time, Thai PM Says

description: Myanmar’s collapsing currency, plummeting dollar reserves and soaring inflation are pushing the economy deeper into crisis, estimates by the shadow National Unity Government show.
title: Myanmar’s Shadow Government Flags Deepening Economic Turmoil

description: Indonesia plans to give its diaspora similar rights as its citizens as part of efforts to bring back overseas talent.
title: Indonesia Plans to Grant Its Diaspora Similar Rights to Citizens

description: A Chinese spacecraft has lifted off from the far side of the moon but not before marking the historic visit with a bit of patriotic graffiti.
title: China’s Moon Mission Leaves Patriotic Graffiti on Surface

description: Mexico’s peso sank for a second session after the unexpected landslide election win by the ruling party injected local political risk into one of the world’s top carry trades.
title: Mexican Peso Sinks Further as Election Shock Reverberates

description: South African assets are rebounding, fueled by investor hopes that the country will emerge from the next 13 days of coalition talks with a market-friendly government.
title: Rand Gains as Investors Bet Zuma Is Out, DA in For Coalition Government

description: In Poland, Prime Minister Donald Tusk is casting himself as the defender of his country to outflank the populists and far right.
title: Russia’s Threat Puts Security at Forefront of European Elections

description: One of the Tories’ biggest achievements has been bringing unemployment down. Yet people still feel worse off.
title: Why Do Brits Feel Worse Off With Employment This Strong?

description: The Conservatives’ record is marred by a stagnant stock market, foreign takeovers of British firms and a dearth of listings to replace them.
title: The UK Corporate Crisis Has Gone From Bad to Worse

description: The Eurasia Group founder tells In the City why normalization of extreme events will make violence in the coming US election more likely.
title: Ian Bremmer Says America Is a ‘Frog in a Boiling Pot’

description: Frexit and Nexit may be off the menu, but a far-right turn in parliamentary elections risks another lost decade of stagnation.
title: The EU Is Having an Identity Crisis

description: China is taking its domestic economic problems and exporting them to the rest of the world, the US Ambassador to Japan Rahm Emanuel said, adding this strengthens the resolve of America and its partners to stand together.
title: US and Its Partners Stand Together as China Exports Problems, Rahm Emanuel Says

description: When Russian President Vladimir Putin takes the stage at his annual forum in St. Petersburg this week, his country’s business ties with a lower-key Gulf state will be on full display.
title: Russian Commodities Firms Look Beyond the UAE to Oman For Trade

description: Hong Kong’s leader stressed a need to safeguard national security on the 35th anniversary of the Tiananmen Square crackdown in Beijing, signaling the government’s intent to continue a clampdown on dissent even in the absence of open protests.
title: Hong Kong Warns of Security Threat on Tiananmen Anniversary

description: After Donald Trump’s felony conviction last week, commentators in China and Russia wasted little time in trumpeting the failure of American democracy.
title: Trump’s Persecution Claims Get Boost from Russia, China
